page.para: Little Ant has a clever plan
Little Ant loved to read. Little Ant was often teased.
“Ants don’t read. Ants collect the food they need.”
Here is Little Ant reading a book.
Can you see him? Take a look!
The other ants collected all they found.
Then they stored the food underground.
“Little Ant, you must not read.”
“You must collect the food we need.”
In Autumn all the leaves fall down.
All the food is old and brown.
The Queen wants food to fill the store.
All the ants must work some more.
Little Ant began to shout, “There is a place I know about.”
“A restaurant is what we need. It says so in the books I read.”
The ants go marching one by one.
They march into the setting sun.
Little Ant says, “Stop, everyone.”
“We’re here at last. This is the one.”
The ants go marching one by one.
They carry a burger, they carry a bun.
When the ants return the Queen is glad!
The stores are full. They cheer like mad.
“We are so proud,” say Mum and Dad.
“You really are a clever lad.”
